intro: Machaeranthera verna, commonly known as spring blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its showy, yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Machaeranthera verna is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
